title: The First Derivative Rule
text: If f′ changes sign from positive when $$x<c$$ to negative when $$x>c$$, then f(c) is a local maximum of f.\nIf f′ changes sign from negative when $$x<c$$ to positive when $$x>c$$, then f(c) is a local minimum of f.\nIf f' has the same sign for $$x<c$$ and $$x>c$$, then f(c) is neither a local maximum nor a local minimum of f.
